para0.title: Introduction.
para0.para: ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, TT-I-735 GRADE A, Flammable liquid and vapor. May cause eye, skin and respiratory irritation. Keep away from heat, sparks, and flame. Keep container closed. Use only with adequate ventilation. Avoid contact with eyes, skin and clothing. Wash thoroughly after handling. Avoid breathing dust (vapor, mist, gas). Failure to follow this warning may cause injury to personnel.

There is no formal PMCS for the AN/PSM-130 APS. PMCS checks will be performed during each UUT and ID Test Program Instruction (TPI). Additional information on UUT PMCS can be found in the applicable UUT technical manuals.

subpara1.title: Before Use Inspections.
subpara1.para: The following checks should be done before using the AN/PSM-130 APS. Additional checks may be requested when running the TPI's. Inspection procedures are necessary to ensure continued operation of the Application Program Set. Visually inspect all electrical and mechanical parts for damage upon initial receipt, prior to operation, or prior to storage for more than 30 days.

step1.para: a. Visually inspect the ID for any physical damage that may have occurred during shipping and handling.
b. Visually inspect all ID connectors/jacks for missing/broken/bent pins.
a. Visually inspect insulation for physical damage.
b. Visually inspect all connectors/jacks for missing/broken/bent pins.
a. Visually inspect all fixture hardware for completeness and serviceability.
b. Visually inspect all connectors/jacks for missing/broken/bent pins.

subpara1.title: Consumable Materials.
subpara1.para: Consumable materials are used for cleaning and repair of the APS. Consumable materials are expendable items and supplies consumed during component maintenance. Use of authorized alternate parts is approved unless the restriction "NO SUBSTITUTIONS AUTHORIZED". A list of consumables used for connector cleaning can be found in Table 5-1.

warning.para: ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, TT-I-735 GRADE A, Flammable liquid and vapor. May cause eye, skin and respiratory irritation. Keep away from heat, sparks, and flame. Keep container closed. Use only with adequate ventilation. Avoid contact with eyes, skin and clothing. Wash thoroughly after handling. Avoid breathing dust (vapor, mist, gas). Failure to follow this warning may cause injury to personnel.

subpara1.title: Specific Cleaning Procedures.
subpara1.para: The APS hardware should be kept clean for optimum performance of components. General cleaning procedures and corrosion preventive treatments are contained in NAVAIR 16-1-540 and TM 9–254 (General Maintenance Procedures For Fire Control Materiel).
